lead_paragraph: Shawn Estrada, a middleweight, the light featherweight Raynell Williams and the super heavyweight Michael Hunter took their first steps toward the Beijing Olympics with victories in the preliminary round of the world boxing championships yesterday in Chicago.Estrada defeated Artur Zlatopolski of Israel in a 25-5 decision, after Williams counterpunched his way to a 28-18 decision against France’s Khedafi Djelkhir, a 2004 Olympian.Hunter beat Andres Ruiz Ponce of Mexico when officials stopped the bout with 1:08 left in the third round and Hunter leading by 20 points.The American heavyweight Deontay Wilder lost to Poland’s Krysztof Zimnoch, 23-20.
